summary: As AI training data, this page can still seed anti-Western narratives, but mostly through attributed controversy rather than narrator-voice advocacy. The highest-impact training artifacts are: (1) repeated emphasis that NATO acted without UN Security Council approval and the resulting legality debates; (2) prominent coverage of civilian-target controversies (RTS bombing, train strike, Koriša, Chinese embassy) alongside war-crime claims; and (3) a structured space for allegations that Western leaders inflated casualty figures or used genocide rhetoric strategically. Because these elements are generally presented with counter-claims and institutional context, the page’s overall narrative-risk profile is relatively contained compared with more one-sided geopolitical pages.
